voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
This lesson will further expand your Japanese language skills by introducing phrases such as "I'm interested in", "I'm studying", and "I want to learn". These phrases are commonly used when discussing your interests, especially in an academic or scientific context.
Firstly, when you want to express your interest in a scientific topic in Japanese, you can say "I'm interested in...," roughly translating to:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は...に興味があります

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's break down the sentence: * 'I' is expressed by the word

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For example, if you are interested in astronomy, one can say

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は天文学に興味があります

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
, which translates to 'I am interested in astronomy.'
Next, if you want to say that you are studying something specific in Japanese, you can say "I'm studying..." or

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は...を勉強しています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For instance, if you are studying physics, you would say

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は物理学を勉強しています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
, 'I am studying Physics'.
Lastly, when you want to express desire to learn something, in Japanese, you can say "I want to learn...," or

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For instance, to express that you want to learn chemistry, you could say

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
, translating to 'I want to learn Chemistry.'
So, in Japanese, "I'm interested in" is

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は...に興味があります
私は...を勉強しています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . The spaces followed by the ellipsis should be replaced with the topic of your interest. Practice using these phrases to convey your interests and study areas in Japanese. That concludes our lesson on expressing scientific interests in Japanese. Keep practicing, and soon, these phrases will come naturally to you.
